item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 4, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. What went wrong with wireless USB (190 points | 81 comments)
2. Gorgeous-GRUB: collection of decent community-made GRUB themes (260 points | 62 comments)
3. Show HN: Free, in-browser PDF editor (518 points | 110 comments)
4. Switch bouncing reference traces for a variety of different switches (23 points | 7 comments)
5. DuckDB is probably the most important geospatial software of the last decade (308 points | 88 comments)
6. Show HN: I taught AI to commentate Pong in real time (23 points | 2 comments)
7. Pascal for Small Machines (67 points | 6 comments)
8. Metagenomics test saves woman's sight after mystery infection (115 points | 40 comments)
9. Elvish – Powerful scripting language and versatile interactive shell (26 points | 11 comments)
10. I built a pixel art editor after playing Octopath Traveler II (59 points | 26 comments)
11. Legendary Bose Magic Carpet Suspension Is Finally Going Global (161 points | 108 comments)
12. Britain's Latest True Crime Thriller: Who Killed the Sycamore Tree? (16 points | 25 comments)
13. Time saved by AI offset by new work created, study suggests (348 points | 320 comments)
14. Programmers Guide to the AMIBIOS (1993) [pdf] (51 points | 10 comments)
15. A Survey of AI Agent Protocols (57 points | 28 comments)
16. Why can't HTML alone do includes? (303 points | 254 comments)
17. Anatomy of a 'zombie' volcano: Investigating the cause of unrest inside Uturuncu (3 points | 1 comment)
18. Numerical Linear Algebra Class in Julia TUM (100 points | 4 comments)
19. Google Gemini has the worst LLM API (102 points | 83 comments)
20. A PostgreSQL planner semi-join gotcha with CTE, LIMIT, and RETURNING (42 points | 31 comments)
21. When flat rate movers won't answer your calls (233 points | 154 comments)
22. Why I Am Not Going to Buy a Computer (1987) [pdf] (91 points | 51 comments)
23. QModem 4.51 Source Code (190 points | 70 comments)
24. We fell out of love with Next.js and back in love with Ruby on Rails (370 points | 326 comments)
25. DotnetSnes: Library allowing to use C# to create SNES ROMs (29 points | 3 comments)
26. Run LLMs on Apple Neural Engine (ANE) (254 points | 103 comments)
27. A simple Common Lisp web app (36 points | 9 comments)
28. Why I stopped angel investing after 15 years (and what I'm doing instead) (194 points | 162 comments)
29. Minimum Viable Blog (326 points | 159 comments)
30. Bethesda Thinks Fan Remaster of Oblivion Is 'Very Special' and Supports It (68 points | 46 comments)
